image.altText: A temporary fence with the words ADELAIDE WRITERS on it

props.synopsis: South Australia's premier told the Adelaide Festival board it would open itself to "accusations of hypocrisy" and "legitimate public ridicule" if it did not cancel the appearance of Randa Abdel-Fattah from Writers' Week.

title.children: Author's appearance would cause 'legitimate public ridicule', premier told board

image.altText: NSW Police at shark attack 180126

props.synopsis: Emergency services were called to Hermitage Foreshore Walk near Shark Beach at Vaucluse about 4:20pm on Sunday afternoon following reports of a boy being bitten by a shark.

title.children: Boy in critical condition after shark attack at Sydney Harbour beach

image.altText: A man in a suit gesturing

props.synopsis: Tehran is the epicentre of the nightly protests shaking Iran's regime, but the reverberations are being felt loud and clear in Moscow, too.

title.children: Putin's 'worst-case scenario' could be realised in Iran regime change

image.altText: Peter Dutton looks down while delivering his concession speech

props.synopsis: The report, co-authored by Liberal grandees Pru Goward and Nick Minchin, has now been sent to a legal team to ensure it is watertight while the party decides what step to take next.

title.children: Liberal election autopsy delayed after Dutton suggests report defamatory

image.altText: A car crashed into a shopping centre with police tape.

props.synopsis: The accident happened at Mawson shopping centre in Canberra's south.

title.children: Four-year-old boy dies after car crashes into Canberra shopping centre

image.altText: A ball kid, highlighted, falls during an Australian Open match between Zeynep Sönmez and Ekaterina Alexandrova.

props.synopsis: A ball kid has fainted and fallen onto their back while standing at the net during a match on day one of the Australian Open. Follow live.

title.children: Player praised for 'incredible' act, helping ball kid after scary fall

image.altText: Cows walking on the road

props.synopsis: Numerous flood warnings remain active across central Queensland, with ex-Tropical Cyclone Koji still driving floodwater through major catchments, while the premier met with graziers on Sunday to discuss massive stock losses.

title.children: Queensland stock losses to hit 100,000 as flood warnings continue

image.altText: A road flooded with water.

props.synopsis: The State Emergency Service responds to more than 2,300 incidents and 25 flood rescues, most of which involve people driving through floodwaters.

title.children: Thousands without power amid NSW flooding, stormy weather and landslide

image.altText: a big white ship with "global mercy" written on it's bow

props.synopsis: On the largest civilian hospital ship in the world, Australian volunteers provide life-changing healthcare that is transforming lives.

title.children: On the world's largest hospital ship volunteers give people a chance at a better life

image.altText: Protesters gather in front of the US consulate during a demonstration in Nuuk

props.synopsis: Donald Trump announces the escalating tariffs for Denmark, Norway, Sweden, France, Germany, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and Finland as a row over Greenland continues.

title.children: Trump vows tariffs on eight European countries over Greenland stand-off

image.altText: Anthony Albanese wears a suit and blue tie, and black-rimmed glasses. He stares intently just past the camera.

props.synopsis: A special sitting to respond to the Bondi terror attack will begin in Canberra on Monday, but the government is no closer to landing changes to hate laws.

title.children: Status of hate laws remains uncertain as politicians converge on Canberra

image.altText: Underwater photo of coral reef and fish with sun rays streaming through turquoise waters.

props.synopsis: The High Seas Treaty will govern about two-thirds of the planet's oceans including vast areas beyond any country's borders.

title.children: World's first legally binding treaty to protect oceans takes effect

image.altText: Dog at a press conference

props.synopsis: People who leave their dogs in hot cars could be sent to prison, under changes to animal welfare laws being proposed by the state government.

title.children: Dog owners face prison time under proposed new 'hot car' offence in NSW

image.altText: Cosplayers dressed in various colourful outfits, addressing a crowd inside the library.

props.synopsis: Has a surge in the popularity of hit shows like Stranger Things led to an uptick in geekiness, changing how we feel about nerd culture? The ABC attended Darwin's Geektacular event to find out.

title.children: 'It's all about fun': Cosplayers unite in celebration of geek culture

image.altText: Trum, with a raised fist, and Netanyahu smiles

props.synopsis: The committee announced by the White House includes no Israeli officials but has an Israeli businessperson, billionaire Yakir Gabay.

title.children: Israel objects to US announcement of leaders in Gaza peace plan

image.altText: A young girl smiling as she receives treatment in hospital.

props.synopsis: Abbey was "joy on two legs" and now she is gone, another lost to brain cancer. Somehow her family must carry on, as the fight continues for more funding to bring this horror disease to an end.

title.children: None in family history, yet 'cancer still found us in the worst way'

image.altText: Black actors playing father and son smiling at it other while laying down.

props.synopsis: Pasa Faho is the story of a shoe salesman who struggles to save his small business and pass on his values to his son.

title.children: Pasa Faho tells the story of a shoe salesman's struggles to keep his shop and raise his son

image.altText: Bo Nix celebrates after throwing a touchdown pass for the Denver Broncos

props.synopsis: As the final four NFL teams prepare to battle it out for a place in the Super Bowl, a last-minute injury to Denver quarterback Bo Nix has thrown the race for the championship into chaos.

title.children: Why one last-second injury has turned the NFL playoffs on its head

image.altText: Two road race cyclists, in blue and orange, tussle for the elad

props.synopsis: Kiwi Ally Wollaston has outsprinted defending champion Noemi Ruegg to claim stage two of the Tour Down Under and keep the race lead.

title.children: Wollaston produces storming finish to maintain Tour Down Under lead

image.altText: Allan Iverson stands next to Bryce Cotton.

props.synopsis: NBA great Allen Iverson left hundreds of fans star struck at a meet-and-greet event in Perth, none more so than one of the best NBL players of all time.

title.children: Australian fans pay hundreds of dollars to meet NBA icon Allen 'The Answer' Iverson

image.altText: An aircraft flies at nightime with bright lights shining from its wings

props.synopsis: CENTCOM says it conducted a strike in north-west Syria that resulted in the death of an Al Qaeda operative linked to the ISIS gunman responsible for killing two US soldiers and a US civilian in Syria on December 13.

title.children: US kills 'terrorist' operative linked to deadly IS ambush of three Americans in Syria

image.altText: Smoke rising from a large fire at Croydon Park.

props.synopsis: About 90 firefighters have been battling a large blaze at Croydon Park that sent a large plume of smoke above the suburbs and came close to batteries for home solar systems.

title.children: Firefighters stop big Adelaide blaze spreading to solar batteries

image.altText: A kangaroo sits alone on a burnt out hill

props.synopsis: From animal shelters to "entire generations" of bat colonies, heartbreaking stories of the significant loss of animal life are beginning to emerge in the wake of Victoria's disastrous bushfires and severe heat.

title.children: Bushfires' devastating toll on animal life beginning to emerge

image.altText: A red BHP logo on a glass building in front of a grey sky

props.synopsis: The year is barely underway but already there's a power struggle between our biggest corporations as they fight it out for line honours.

title.children: BHP gains ground as CBA loses market share in battle of corporates

image.altText: Man with a moustach holding up a rubber replica southern bluefin tuna that has a rope through its gills.

props.synopsis: Port Lincoln's world-famous Tunarama Festival has returned to the South Australian event calendar, with thousands of people lining the streets to celebrate the seafood industry.

title.children: Return of the flying fish lures tourists to seafood capital

image.altText: Damage to a store in Perth which was set on fire.

props.synopsis: A taskforce will be assembled to combat Western Australia's illicit tobacco market, with plans to pull retired and current police officers into the Department of Health.

title.children: 'Illicit tobacco tzar' appointed to lead team in black market crackdown

image.altText: Standing atop a pillar, men cheer as a statue of a horse tumbles down its side

props.synopsis: Protesters are urging US President Donald Trump to help dismantle Iran's theocracy. If he answers the call, it won't be the first time the US has toppled an Iranian government.

title.children: The CIA orchestrated an Iranian coup seven decades ago. It still haunts the US

image.altText: A man catching a wave on a white surfboard

props.synopsis: Former professional surfers and board makers have chosen this small coastal paradise as their home, but with smaller waves, what makes it so special?

title.children: Tourists triple the population of this coastal town, and some never leave

image.altText: Boats racing on water.

props.synopsis: Reigning Sail Grand Prix champions Great Britain make the best possible start to season 2026, taking the win in Fremantle with a strong two-day performance culminating with victory in Sunday's final.

title.children: Great Britain edges Australia to win SailGP event in Perth

image.altText: A composite image showing three Instagram posts of TL Huang at a weight loss camp.

props.synopsis: Camps offering intensive weight loss programs are on the rise in China as the country faces skyrocketing obesity rates.

title.children: Australian woman documents her stint in Chinese weight loss 'prison'

image.altText: Four people in yellow fire jackets stand in a row (two men, a woman and another man).

props.synopsis: The volunteer brigade from Terip Terip went through "hell" and back, narrowly escaping death while fighting to save their own community and those nearby.

title.children: As a bushfire raged around them, a volunteer brigade made a plan to survive

image.altText: A man taking a selfie with his wife and four daughters near a beach

props.synopsis: Experts on the benefit of charging board and expenses if you’re sharing a home with young adults, and how to calculate it.

title.children: How to calculate board or rent if you have adult children at home

image.altText: A woman with dark, curly hair sits outside a house.

props.synopsis: Kalgoorlie resident Sahar still hasn't heard from her family, but she's hoping protests in Iran will bring change.

title.children: Sahar is worried sick, but hopes the day she can return to Iran is coming

image.altText: Koala sitting in a tree

props.synopsis: South Australia's Mount Lofty Ranges is experiencing a koala population boom that would likely lead to starvation and deaths, researchers say.

title.children: Adelaide Hills koala population boom risks starvation, study finds
